Fact.Name: Adjusted Gross Income
Fact.Description: Total income to report on line 11 of Form 1040.
Taxable income as reported on line 15 of Form 1040. Should not be negative.
Taxable income without the QBI Deduction, with coordination with OB3 70111 to exclude limitation on itemized deduction

Fact.Name: Modified Adjusted Gross Income for OB3 Below Line Deductions
Fact.Description: Adjusted gross income of the taxpayer for the taxable year increased by any amount excluded from gross income under section 911, 931, or 933.

Fact.Name: Rounded taxable income
Fact.Description: Income less than $100,000 uses the tax tables from the Instructions for Form 1040. This fact selects the "midpoint" that corresponds to each entry in the tax tables, for use in calculating tentative tax.
Tentative tax as reported on line 16 of Form 1040, excluding any qualified dividends or capital gains. Rev Proc .01 Tax Rate Tables §1(j)(2)(A|B|C|D)
Remaining taxable income after subtracting qualified dividends and long-term capital gains. Line 5 - Qualified Dividends and Capital Gain Worksheet

Fact.Name: Rounded taxable income minus net gains

Fact.Description: Line 22 Qualified Dividends Capital Gains Worksheet. Required to calculate Form 1040 line 16 when qualified dividends and capital gains are present
Tentative tax for all taxable income + QDCGs Line 23 - Qualified Dividends and Capital Gain Worksheet

Lesser of tentative tax without net capital gains and tentative tax with capital gains. /tentativeTaxFromTaxableIncomeWithNetCapitalGains will be smaller than /tentativeTaxFromTaxableIncomeWithoutNetGains if net capital gains is negative (net capital loss), in which case we want to tax the taxpayer at a lower rate based on the loss. Line 16 Form 1040 Line 25 - Qualified Dividends and Capital Gain Worksheet
Schedule 2 Line 3. Form 1040 line 17. Summation of Lines 1a-z and 2, all of which are not supported in TWE today
Schedule 2 Line 21. Form 1040 line 23.

Fact.Name: Total tentative tax
Fact.Description: Form 1040 Line 18. Total tentative tax

Fact.Name: Total tentative tax after applying non-refundable credits, but before applying refundable credits.
Fact.Description: Form 1040 Line 22.
Form 1040 Line 24. Taxes from taxable income minus non-refundable credits plus other taxes, including self-employment tax.
Form 1040 Line 33

Form 1040 Line 37. Estimated total taxes owed. The tax liability minus the total credits and total advance payments made during the tax year. Negative value = overpayment = refund Positive value = underpayment = balance due
Total Tax - total payments + estimated tax
Threshold at which the top tax bracket (37%) applies by filing status. https://www.irs.gov/pub/irs-drop/rp-25-32.pdf

Fact.Name: Modified Adjusted Gross Income for Student Loan Interest Deduction
Fact.Description: This is AGI, but without student loan interest deduction.

Taxable income for calculating itemized deduction cap for itemizers. By default excludes standard deduction because the taxpayer is itemizing, as well as itemized deduction to avoid circular dependency.
Excess taxable income over the 37% tax rate. Different brackets apply depending on filing status

Schedule SE Line 7. Maximum amount of combined wages and self-employment earnings subject to social security tax or the 6.2% portion of the 7.65% railroad retirement (tier 1) tax for 2026. See https://www.ssa.gov/oact/cola/cbb.html
Schedule 8812 Line 21
Schedule 8812 Line 23
